093import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.LINK_PLAIN;

095/**
096 * The taglet writer that writes HTML.
097 */
098public class TagletWriterImpl extends TagletWriter {
099    /**
100     * A class that provides the information about the enclosing context for
101     * a series of {@code DocTree} nodes.
102     * This context may be used to determine the content that should be generated from the tree nodes.
103     */
104    static class Context {
105        /**
106         * Whether or not the trees are appearing in a context of just the first sentence,
107         * such as in the summary table of the enclosing element.
108         */
109        final boolean isFirstSentence;
110        /**
111         * Whether or not the trees are appearing in the "summary" section of the
112         * page for a declaration.
113         */
114        final boolean inSummary;
115        /**
116         * The set of enclosing kinds of tags.
117         */
118        final Set<DocTree.Kind> inTags;
119
120        /**
121         * Creates an outermost context, with no enclosing tags.
122         *
123         * @param isFirstSentence {@code true} if the trees are appearing in a context of just the
124         *                        first sentence and {@code false} otherwise
125         * @param inSummary       {@code true} if the trees are appearing in the "summary" section
126         *                        of the page for a declaration and {@code false} otherwise
127         */
128        Context(boolean isFirstSentence, boolean inSummary) {
129            this(isFirstSentence, inSummary,
130                EnumSet.noneOf(DocTree.Kind.class));
131        }
132
133        private Context(boolean isFirstSentence, boolean inSummary,
134                Set<DocTree.Kind> inTags) {
135            this.isFirstSentence = isFirstSentence;
136            this.inSummary = inSummary;
137            this.inTags = inTags;
138        }
139
140        /**
141         * Creates a new {@code Context} that includes an extra tag kind in the set of enclosing
142         * kinds of tags.
143         *
144         * @param tree the enclosing tree
145         *
146         * @return the new {@code Context}
147         */
148        Context within(DocTree tree) {
149            var newInTags = EnumSet.copyOf(inTags);
150            newInTags.add(tree.getKind());
151            return new Context(isFirstSentence, inSummary, newInTags);
152        }
153    }
154
155    private final HtmlDocletWriter htmlWriter;
156    private final HtmlConfiguration configuration;
157    private final HtmlOptions options;
158    private final Utils utils;
159    private final Resources resources;
160
161    private final Messages messages;
162
163    private final Contents contents;
164    private final Context context;
165
166    // Threshold for length of @see tag label for switching from inline to block
167    // layout.
168    private static final int TAG_LIST_ITEM_MAX_INLINE_LENGTH = 30;
169
170    /**
171     * Creates a taglet writer.
172     *
173     * @param htmlWriter      the {@code HtmlDocletWriter} for the page
174     * @param isFirstSentence {@code true} if this taglet writer is being used for a
175     *                        "first sentence" summary
176     */
177    public TagletWriterImpl(HtmlDocletWriter htmlWriter,
178            boolean isFirstSentence) {
179        this(htmlWriter, isFirstSentence, false);
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Creates a taglet writer.
184     *
185     * @param htmlWriter      the {@code HtmlDocletWriter} for the page
186     * @param isFirstSentence {@code true} if this taglet writer is being used for a
187     *                        "first sentence" summary, and {@code false} otherwise
188     * @param inSummary       {@code true} if this taglet writer is being used for the content
189     *                        of a {@code {@summary ...}} tag, and {@code false} otherwise
190     */
191    public TagletWriterImpl(HtmlDocletWriter htmlWriter,
192            boolean isFirstSentence, boolean inSummary) {
193        this(htmlWriter, new Context(isFirstSentence, inSummary));
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Creates a taglet writer.
198     *
199     * @param htmlWriter the {@code HtmlDocletWriter} for the page
200     * @param context    the enclosing context for any tags
201     */
202    public TagletWriterImpl(HtmlDocletWriter htmlWriter, Context context) {
203        super(context.isFirstSentence);
204        this.htmlWriter = htmlWriter;
205        this.context = context;
206        configuration = htmlWriter.configuration;
207        options = configuration.getOptions();
208        utils = configuration.utils;
209        messages = configuration.messages;
210        resources = configuration.getDocResources();
211        contents = configuration.getContents();
212    }
213
214    @Override
215    public Content getOutputInstance() {
216        return new ContentBuilder();
217    }
218
219    @Override
220    protected Content codeTagOutput(Element element, LiteralTree tag) {
221        return HtmlTree
222            .CODE(Text.of(Text.normalizeNewlines(tag.getBody().getBody())));
223    }
224
225    @Override
226    protected Content indexTagOutput(Element element, IndexTree tag) {
227        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
228
229        DocTree searchTerm = tag.getSearchTerm();
230        String tagText
231            = (searchTerm instanceof TextTree tt) ? tt.getBody() : "";
232        if (tagText.charAt(0) == '"'
233            && tagText.charAt(tagText.length() - 1) == '"') {
234            tagText = tagText.substring(1, tagText.length() - 1);
235        }
236        tagText = tagText.replaceAll("\\s+", " ");
237
238        Content desc = htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element,
239            tag.getDescription(), context.within(tag));
240        String descText = extractText(desc);
241
242        return createAnchorAndSearchIndex(element, tagText, descText, tag);
243    }
244
245    // ugly but simple;
246    // alternatives would be to walk the Content's tree structure, or to add new
247    // functionality to Content
248    private String extractText(Content c) {
249        return c.toString().replaceAll("<[^>]+>", "");
250    }
251
252    @Override
253    public Content getDocRootOutput() {
254        String path;
255        if (htmlWriter.pathToRoot.isEmpty())
256            path = ".";
257        else
258            path = htmlWriter.pathToRoot.getPath();
259        return Text.of(path);
260    }
261
262    @Override
263    public Content deprecatedTagOutput(Element element) {
264        ContentBuilder result = new ContentBuilder();
265        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
266        List<? extends DeprecatedTree> deprs
267            = utils.getDeprecatedTrees(element);
268        if (utils.isTypeElement(element)) {
269            if (utils.isDeprecated(element)) {
270                result.add(HtmlTree.SPAN(HtmlStyle.deprecatedLabel,
271                    htmlWriter.getDeprecatedPhrase(element)));
272                if (!deprs.isEmpty()) {
273                    List<? extends DocTree> commentTrees
274                        = ch.getDescription(deprs.get(0));
275                    if (!commentTrees.isEmpty()) {
276                        result.add(commentTagsToOutput(element, null,
277                            commentTrees, false));
278                    }
279                }
280            }
281        } else {
282            if (utils.isDeprecated(element)) {
283                result.add(HtmlTree.SPAN(HtmlStyle.deprecatedLabel,
284                    htmlWriter.getDeprecatedPhrase(element)));
285                if (!deprs.isEmpty()) {
286                    List<? extends DocTree> bodyTrees
287                        = ch.getBody(deprs.get(0));
288                    Content body
289                        = commentTagsToOutput(element, null, bodyTrees, false);
290                    if (!body.isEmpty())
291                        result.add(
292                            HtmlTree.DIV(HtmlStyle.deprecationComment, body));
293                }
294            } else {
295                Element ee = utils.getEnclosingTypeElement(element);
296                if (utils.isDeprecated(ee)) {
297                    result.add(HtmlTree.SPAN(HtmlStyle.deprecatedLabel,
298                        htmlWriter.getDeprecatedPhrase(ee)));
299                }
300            }
301        }
302        return result;
303    }
304
305    @Override
306    public Content linkTagOutput(Element element, LinkTree tag) {
307        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
308
309        var linkRef = tag.getReference();
310        if (linkRef == null) {
311            messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(tag),
312                "doclet.link.no_reference");
313            return invalidTagOutput(
314                resources.getText("doclet.tag.invalid_input", tag.toString()),
315                Optional.empty());
316        }
317
318        DocTree.Kind kind = tag.getKind();
319        String refSignature = ch.getReferencedSignature(linkRef);
320
321        return linkSeeReferenceOutput(element,
322            tag,
323            refSignature,
324            ch.getReferencedElement(tag),
325            (kind == LINK_PLAIN),
326            htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, tag.getLabel(), context),
327            (key, args) -> messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(tag), key, args));
328    }
329
330    @Override
331    protected Content literalTagOutput(Element element, LiteralTree tag) {
332        return Text.of(Text.normalizeNewlines(tag.getBody().getBody()));
333    }
334
335    @Override
336    public Content getParamHeader(ParamTaglet.ParamKind kind) {
337        Content header = switch (kind) {
338        case PARAMETER -> contents.parameters;
339        case TYPE_PARAMETER -> contents.typeParameters;
340        case RECORD_COMPONENT -> contents.recordComponents;
341        default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException(kind.toString());
342        };
343        return HtmlTree.DT(header);
344    }
345
346    @Override
347    public Content paramTagOutput(Element element, ParamTree paramTag,
348            String paramName) {
349        ContentBuilder body = new ContentBuilder();
350        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
351        // define id attributes for state components so that generated
352        // descriptions may refer to them
353        boolean defineID = (element.getKind() == ElementKind.RECORD)
354            && !paramTag.isTypeParameter();
355        Content nameContent = Text.of(paramName);
356        body.add(HtmlTree.CODE(defineID
357            ? HtmlTree.SPAN_ID(HtmlIds.forParam(paramName), nameContent)
358            : nameContent));
359        body.add(" - ");
360        List<? extends DocTree> description = ch.getDescription(paramTag);
361        body.add(htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, description,
362            context.within(paramTag)));
363        return HtmlTree.DD(body);
364    }
365
366    @Override
367    public Content returnTagOutput(Element element, ReturnTree returnTag,
368            boolean inline) {
369        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
370        List<? extends DocTree> desc = ch.getDescription(returnTag);
371        Content content = htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, desc,
372            context.within(returnTag));
373        return inline
374            ? new ContentBuilder(
375                contents.getContent("doclet.Returns_0", content))
376            : new ContentBuilder(HtmlTree.DT(contents.returns),
377                HtmlTree.DD(content));
378    }
379
380    @Override
381    public Content seeTagOutput(Element holder,
382            List<? extends SeeTree> seeTags) {
383        List<Content> links = new ArrayList<>();
384        for (SeeTree dt : seeTags) {
385            TagletWriterImpl t
386                = new TagletWriterImpl(htmlWriter, context.within(dt));
387            links.add(t.seeTagOutput(holder, dt));
388        }
389        if (utils.isVariableElement(holder)
390            && ((VariableElement) holder).getConstantValue() != null &&
391            htmlWriter instanceof ClassWriterImpl writer) {
392            // Automatically add link to constant values page for constant
393            // fields.
394            DocPath constantsPath
395                = htmlWriter.pathToRoot.resolve(DocPaths.CONSTANT_VALUES);
396            String whichConstant
397                = writer.getTypeElement().getQualifiedName() + "." +
398                    utils.getSimpleName(holder);
399            DocLink link = constantsPath.fragment(whichConstant);
400            links.add(htmlWriter.links.createLink(link,
401                contents.getContent("doclet.Constants_Summary")));
402        }
403        if (utils.isClass(holder)
404            && utils.isSerializable((TypeElement) holder)) {
405            // Automatically add link to serialized form page for serializable
406            // classes.
407            if (SerializedFormBuilder.serialInclude(utils, holder) &&
408                SerializedFormBuilder.serialInclude(utils,
409                    utils.containingPackage(holder))) {
410                DocPath serialPath
411                    = htmlWriter.pathToRoot.resolve(DocPaths.SERIALIZED_FORM);
412                DocLink link
413                    = serialPath.fragment(utils.getFullyQualifiedName(holder));
414                links.add(htmlWriter.links.createLink(link,
415                    contents.getContent("doclet.Serialized_Form")));
416            }
417        }
418        if (links.isEmpty()) {
419            return Text.EMPTY;
420        }
421        // Use a different style if any link label is longer than 30 chars or
422        // contains commas.
423        boolean hasLongLabels = links.stream().anyMatch(this::isLongOrHasComma);
424        var seeList = HtmlTree
425            .UL(hasLongLabels ? HtmlStyle.tagListLong : HtmlStyle.tagList);
426        links.stream()
427            .filter(Predicate.not(Content::isEmpty))
428            .forEach(item -> seeList.add(HtmlTree.LI(item)));
429
430        return new ContentBuilder(
431            HtmlTree.DT(contents.seeAlso),
432            HtmlTree.DD(seeList));
433    }
434
435    private boolean isLongOrHasComma(Content c) {
436        String s = c.toString()
437            .replaceAll("<.*?>", "")              // ignore HTML
438            .replaceAll("&#?[A-Za-z0-9]+;", " ")  // entities count as a single
439                                                  // character
440            .replaceAll("\\R", "\n");             // normalize newlines
441        return s.length() > TAG_LIST_ITEM_MAX_INLINE_LENGTH || s.contains(",");
442    }
443
444    String textOf(List<? extends DocTree> trees) {
445        return trees.stream()
446            .filter(dt -> dt instanceof TextTree)
447            .map(dt -> ((TextTree) dt).getBody().trim())
448            .collect(Collectors.joining(" "));
449    }
450
451    /**
452     * {@return the output for a single {@code @see} tag}
453     *
454     * @param element the element that has the documentation comment containing this tag
455     * @param seeTag  the tag
456     */
457    private Content seeTagOutput(Element element, SeeTree seeTag) {
458        List<? extends DocTree> ref = seeTag.getReference();
459        assert !ref.isEmpty();
460        DocTree ref0 = ref.get(0);
461        switch (ref0.getKind()) {
462        case TEXT, START_ELEMENT -> {
463            // @see "Reference"
464            // @see <a href="...">...</a>
465            return htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, ref, false, false);
466        }
467
468        case REFERENCE -> {
469            // @see reference label...
470            CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
471            String refSignature = ch.getReferencedSignature(ref0);
472            List<? extends DocTree> label = ref.subList(1, ref.size());
473
474            return linkSeeReferenceOutput(element,
475                seeTag,
476                refSignature,
477                ch.getReferencedElement(seeTag),
478                false,
479                htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, label, context),
480                (key, args) -> messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(seeTag), key,
481                    args));
482        }
483
484        case ERRONEOUS -> {
485            return invalidTagOutput(
486                resources.getText("doclet.tag.invalid_input",
487                    ref0.toString()),
488                Optional.empty());
489        }
490
491        default -> throw new IllegalStateException(ref0.getKind().toString());
492        }
493
494    }
495
496    /**
497     * Worker method to generate a link from the information in different kinds of tags,
498     * such as {@code {@link ...}} tags, {@code @see ...} tags and the {@code link} markup tag
499     * in a {@code {@snippet ...}} tag.
500     *
501     * @param holder        the element that has the documentation comment containing the information
502     * @param refTree       the tree node containing the information, or {@code null} if not available
503     * @param refSignature  the normalized signature of the target of the reference
504     * @param ref           the target of the reference
505     * @param isLinkPlain   {@code true} if the link should be presented in "plain" font,
506     *                      or {@code false} for "code" font
507     * @param label         the label for the link,
508     *                      or an empty item to use a default label derived from the signature
509     * @param reportWarning a function to report warnings about issues found in the reference
510     *
511     * @return the output containing the generated link, or content indicating an error
512     */
513    private Content linkSeeReferenceOutput(Element holder,
514            DocTree refTree,
515            String refSignature,
516            Element ref,
517            boolean isLinkPlain,
518            Content label,
519            BiConsumer<String, Object[]> reportWarning) {
520        Content labelContent = plainOrCode(isLinkPlain, label);
521
522        // The signature from the @see tag. We will output this text when a
523        // label is not specified.
524        Content text = plainOrCode(isLinkPlain,
525            Text.of(Objects.requireNonNullElse(refSignature, "")));
526
527        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(holder);
528        TypeElement refClass = ch.getReferencedClass(ref);
529        Element refMem = ch.getReferencedMember(ref);
530        String refFragment = ch.getReferencedFragment(refSignature);
531
532        if (refFragment == null && refMem != null) {
533            refFragment = refMem.toString();
534        } else if (refFragment != null && refFragment.startsWith("#")) {
535            if (labelContent.isEmpty()) {
536                // A non-empty label is required for fragment links as the
537                // reference target does not provide a useful default label.
538                htmlWriter.messages.error(ch.getDocTreePath(refTree),
539                    "doclet.link.see.no_label");
540                return invalidTagOutput(
541                    resources.getText("doclet.link.see.no_label"),
542                    Optional.of(refSignature));
543            }
544            refFragment = refFragment.substring(1);
545        }
546        if (refClass == null) {
547            ModuleElement refModule = ch.getReferencedModule(ref);
548            if (refModule != null && utils.isIncluded(refModule)) {
549                return htmlWriter.getModuleLink(refModule,
550                    labelContent.isEmpty() ? text : labelContent, refFragment);
551            }
552            // @see is not referencing an included class
553            PackageElement refPackage = ch.getReferencedPackage(ref);
554            if (refPackage != null && utils.isIncluded(refPackage)) {
555                // @see is referencing an included package
556                if (labelContent.isEmpty()) {
557                    labelContent = plainOrCode(isLinkPlain,
558                        Text.of(refPackage.getQualifiedName()));
559                }
560                return htmlWriter.getPackageLink(refPackage, labelContent,
561                    refFragment);
562            } else {
563                // @see is not referencing an included class, module or package.
564                // Check for cross links.
565                String refModuleName = ch.getReferencedModuleName(refSignature);
566                DocLink elementCrossLink = (refPackage != null)
567                    ? htmlWriter.getCrossPackageLink(refPackage)
568                    : (configuration.extern.isModule(refModuleName))
569                        ? htmlWriter.getCrossModuleLink(
570                            utils.elementUtils.getModuleElement(refModuleName))
571                        : null;
572                if (elementCrossLink != null) {
573                    // Element cross link found
574                    return htmlWriter.links.createExternalLink(elementCrossLink,
575                        (labelContent.isEmpty() ? text : labelContent));
576                } else {
577                    // No cross link found so print warning
578                    if (!configuration.isDocLintReferenceGroupEnabled()) {
579                        reportWarning.accept(
580                            "doclet.link.see.reference_not_found",
581                            new Object[] { refSignature });
582                    }
583                    return htmlWriter.invalidTagOutput(
584                        resources.getText("doclet.link.see.reference_invalid"),
585                        Optional
586                            .of(labelContent.isEmpty() ? text : labelContent));
587                }
588            }
589        } else if (refFragment == null) {
590            // Must be a class reference since refClass is not null and
591            // refFragment is null.
592            if (labelContent.isEmpty() && refTree != null) {
593                TypeMirror referencedType = ch.getReferencedType(refTree);
594                if (utils.isGenericType(referencedType)) {
595                    // This is a generic type link, use the TypeMirror
596                    // representation.
597                    return plainOrCode(isLinkPlain, htmlWriter.getLink(
598                        new HtmlLinkInfo(configuration,
599                            HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.LINK_TYPE_PARAMS_AND_BOUNDS,
600                            referencedType)));
601                }
602                labelContent = plainOrCode(isLinkPlain,
603                    Text.of(utils.getSimpleName(refClass)));
604            }
605            return htmlWriter.getLink(new HtmlLinkInfo(configuration,
606                HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.PLAIN, refClass)
607                    .label(labelContent));
608        } else if (refMem == null) {
609            // This is a fragment reference since refClass and refFragment are
610            // not null but refMem is null.
611            return htmlWriter.getLink(new HtmlLinkInfo(configuration,
612                HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.PLAIN, refClass)
613                    .label(labelContent)
614                    .fragment(refFragment)
615                    .style(null));
616        } else {
617            // Must be a member reference since refClass is not null and
618            // refMemName is not null.
619            // refMem is not null, so this @see tag must be referencing a valid
620            // member.
621            TypeElement containing = utils.getEnclosingTypeElement(refMem);
622
623            // Find the enclosing type where the method is actually visible
624            // in the inheritance hierarchy.
625            ExecutableElement overriddenMethod = null;
626            if (refMem.getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD) {
627                VisibleMemberTable vmt
628                    = configuration.getVisibleMemberTable(containing);
629                overriddenMethod
630                    = vmt.getOverriddenMethod((ExecutableElement) refMem);
631
632                if (overriddenMethod != null) {
633                    containing
634                        = utils.getEnclosingTypeElement(overriddenMethod);
635                }
636            }
637            if (refSignature.trim().startsWith("#") &&
638                !(utils.isPublic(containing) || utils.isLinkable(containing))) {
639                // Since the link is relative and the holder is not even being
640                // documented, this must be an inherited link. Redirect it.
641                // The current class either overrides the referenced member or
642                // inherits it automatically.
643                if (htmlWriter instanceof ClassWriterImpl writer) {
644                    containing = writer.getTypeElement();
645                } else if (!utils.isPublic(containing)) {
646                    reportWarning.accept(
647                        "doclet.link.see.reference_not_accessible",
648                        new Object[] {
649                            utils.getFullyQualifiedName(containing) });
650                } else {
651                    if (!configuration.isDocLintReferenceGroupEnabled()) {
652                        reportWarning.accept(
653                            "doclet.link.see.reference_not_found",
654                            new Object[] { refSignature });
655                    }
656                }
657            }
658            String refMemName = refFragment;
659            if (configuration.currentTypeElement != containing) {
660                refMemName = (utils.isConstructor(refMem))
661                    ? refMemName
662                    : utils.getSimpleName(containing) + "." + refMemName;
663            }
664            if (utils.isExecutableElement(refMem)) {
665                if (refMemName.indexOf('(') < 0) {
666                    refMemName += utils
667                        .makeSignature((ExecutableElement) refMem, null, true);
668                }
669                if (overriddenMethod != null) {
670                    // The method to actually link.
671                    refMem = overriddenMethod;
672                }
673            }
674
675            return htmlWriter.getDocLink(HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.SHOW_PREVIEW,
676                containing,
677                refMem, (labelContent.isEmpty()
678                    ? plainOrCode(isLinkPlain, Text.of(refMemName))
679                    : labelContent),
680                null, false);
681        }
682    }
683
684    private Content plainOrCode(boolean plain, Content body) {
685        return (plain || body.isEmpty()) ? body : HtmlTree.CODE(body);
686    }
687
688    @Override
689    public Content simpleBlockTagOutput(Element element,
690            List<? extends DocTree> simpleTags, String header) {
691        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
692        ContentBuilder body = new ContentBuilder();
693        boolean many = false;
694        for (DocTree simpleTag : simpleTags) {
695            if (many) {
696                body.add(", ");
697            }
698            List<? extends DocTree> bodyTags = ch.getBody(simpleTag);
699            body.add(htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, bodyTags,
700                context.within(simpleTag)));
701            many = true;
702        }
703        return new ContentBuilder(
704            HtmlTree.DT(RawHtml.of(header)),
705            HtmlTree.DD(body));
706    }
707
708    @Override
709    protected Content snippetTagOutput(Element element, SnippetTree tag,
710            StyledText content,
711            String id, String lang) {
712        var pre = new HtmlTree(TagName.PRE).setStyle(HtmlStyle.snippet);
713        if (id != null && !id.isBlank()) {
714            pre.put(HtmlAttr.ID, id);
715        }
716        var code = new HtmlTree(TagName.CODE)
717            .addUnchecked(Text.EMPTY); // Make sure the element is always
718                                       // rendered
719        if (lang != null && !lang.isBlank()) {
720            code.addStyle("language-" + lang);
721        }
722
723        content.consumeBy((styles, sequence) -> {
724            CharSequence text = Text.normalizeNewlines(sequence);
725            if (styles.isEmpty()) {
726                code.add(text);
727            } else {
728                Element e = null;
729                String t = null;
730                boolean linkEncountered = false;
731                boolean markupEncountered = false;
732                Set<String> classes = new HashSet<>();
733                for (Style s : styles) {
734                    if (s instanceof Style.Name n) {
735                        classes.add(n.name());
736                    } else if (s instanceof Style.Link l) {
737                        assert !linkEncountered; // TODO: do not assert; pick
738                                                 // the first link report on
739                                                 // subsequent
740                        linkEncountered = true;
741                        t = l.target();
742                        e = getLinkedElement(element, t);
743                        if (e == null) {
744                            // TODO: diagnostic output
745                        }
746                    } else if (s instanceof Style.Markup) {
747                        markupEncountered = true;
748                        break;
749                    } else {
750                        // TODO: transform this if...else into an exhaustive
751                        // switch over the sealed Style hierarchy when "Pattern
752                        // Matching for switch" has been implemented (JEP 406
753                        // and friends)
754                        throw new AssertionError(styles);
755                    }
756                }
757                Content c;
758                if (markupEncountered) {
759                    return;
760                } else if (linkEncountered) {
761                    assert e != null;
762                    // disable preview tagging inside the snippets:
763                    PreviewFlagProvider prevPreviewProvider
764                        = utils.setPreviewFlagProvider(el -> false);
765                    try {
766                        c = linkSeeReferenceOutput(element,
767                            null,
768                            t,
769                            e,
770                            false, // TODO: for now
771                            Text.of(sequence.toString()),
772                            (key, args) -> {
773                                /* TODO: report diagnostic */ });
774                    } finally {
775                        utils.setPreviewFlagProvider(prevPreviewProvider);
776                    }
777                } else {
778                    c = HtmlTree.SPAN(Text.of(text));
779                    classes.forEach(((HtmlTree) c)::addStyle);
780                }
781                code.add(c);
782            }
783        });
784        String copyText = resources.getText("doclet.Copy_to_clipboard");
785        String copiedText = resources.getText("doclet.Copied_to_clipboard");
786        String copySnippetText
787            = resources.getText("doclet.Copy_snippet_to_clipboard");
788        var snippetContainer = HtmlTree.DIV(HtmlStyle.snippetContainer,
789            new HtmlTree(TagName.BUTTON)
790                .add(HtmlTree.SPAN(Text.of(copyText))
791                    .put(HtmlAttr.DATA_COPIED, copiedText))
792                .add(new HtmlTree(TagName.IMG)
793                    .put(HtmlAttr.SRC,
794                        htmlWriter.pathToRoot.resolve(DocPaths.CLIPBOARD_SVG)
795                            .getPath())
796                    .put(HtmlAttr.ALT, copySnippetText))
797                .addStyle(HtmlStyle.copy)
798                .addStyle(HtmlStyle.snippetCopy)
799                .put(HtmlAttr.ARIA_LABEL, copySnippetText)
800                .put(HtmlAttr.ONCLICK, "copySnippet(this)"));
801        return snippetContainer.add(pre.add(code));
802    }
803
804    /*
805     * Returns the element that is linked from the context of the referrer using
806     * the provided signature; returns null if such element could not be found.
807     *
808     * This method is to be used when it is the target of the link that is
809     * important, not the container of the link (e.g. was it an @see,
810     * 
811     * @link/@linkplain or @snippet tags, etc.)
812     */
813    public Element getLinkedElement(Element referer, String signature) {
814        var factory = utils.docTrees.getDocTreeFactory();
815        var docCommentTree = utils.getDocCommentTree(referer);
816        var rootPath
817            = new DocTreePath(utils.getTreePath(referer), docCommentTree);
818        var reference = factory.newReferenceTree(signature);
819        var fabricatedPath = new DocTreePath(rootPath, reference);
820        return utils.docTrees.getElement(fabricatedPath);
821    }
822
823    @Override
824    public Content specTagOutput(Element holder,
825            List<? extends SpecTree> specTags) {
826        if (specTags.isEmpty()) {
827            return Text.EMPTY;
828        }
829
830        List<Content> links = specTags.stream()
831            .map(st -> specTagToContent(holder, st))
832            .collect(Collectors.toList());
833
834        // Use a different style if any link label is longer than 30 chars or
835        // contains commas.
836        boolean hasLongLabels = links.stream().anyMatch(this::isLongOrHasComma);
837        var specList = HtmlTree
838            .UL(hasLongLabels ? HtmlStyle.tagListLong : HtmlStyle.tagList);
839        links.stream()
840            .filter(Predicate.not(Content::isEmpty))
841            .forEach(item -> specList.add(HtmlTree.LI(item)));
842
843        return new ContentBuilder(
844            HtmlTree.DT(contents.externalSpecifications),
845            HtmlTree.DD(specList));
846    }
847
848    private Content specTagToContent(Element holder, SpecTree specTree) {
849        String specTreeURL = specTree.getURL().getBody();
850        List<? extends DocTree> specTreeLabel = specTree.getTitle();
851        Content label = htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(holder, specTreeLabel,
852            isFirstSentence);
853        return getExternalSpecContent(holder, specTree, specTreeURL,
854            textOf(specTreeLabel).replaceAll("\\s+", " "), label);
855    }
856
857    Content getExternalSpecContent(Element holder, DocTree docTree, String url,
858            String searchText, Content title) {
859        URI specURI;
860        try {
861            // Use the canonical title of the spec if one is available
862            specURI = new URI(url);
863        } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
864            CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(holder);
865            DocTreePath dtp = ch.getDocTreePath(docTree);
866            htmlWriter.messages.error(dtp, "doclet.Invalid_URL",
867                e.getMessage());
868            specURI = null;
869        }
870
871        Content titleWithAnchor = createAnchorAndSearchIndex(holder,
872            searchText,
873            title,
874            resources.getText("doclet.External_Specification"),
875            docTree);
876
877        if (specURI == null) {
878            return titleWithAnchor;
879        } else {
880            return HtmlTree.A(htmlWriter.resolveExternalSpecURI(specURI),
881                titleWithAnchor);
882        }
883
884    }
885
886    @Override
887    protected Content systemPropertyTagOutput(Element element,
888            SystemPropertyTree tag) {
889        String tagText = tag.getPropertyName().toString();
890        return HtmlTree.CODE(createAnchorAndSearchIndex(element, tagText,
891            resources.getText("doclet.System_Property"), tag));
892    }
893
894    @Override
895    public Content getThrowsHeader() {
896        return HtmlTree.DT(contents.throws_);
897    }
898
899    @Deprecated(forRemoval = true)
900    private Content throwsTagOutput(Element element, ThrowsTree throwsTag,
901            TypeMirror substituteType) {
902        ContentBuilder body = new ContentBuilder();
903        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
904        Element exception = ch.getException(throwsTag);
905        Content excName;
906        if (substituteType != null) {
907            excName = htmlWriter.getLink(
908                new HtmlLinkInfo(configuration, HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.PLAIN,
909                    substituteType));
910        } else if (exception == null) {
911            excName = Text.of(throwsTag.getExceptionName().toString());
912        } else if (exception.asType() == null) {
913            excName = Text.of(utils.getFullyQualifiedName(exception));
914        } else {
915            HtmlLinkInfo link
916                = new HtmlLinkInfo(configuration, HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.PLAIN,
917                    exception.asType());
918            excName = htmlWriter.getLink(link);
919        }
920        body.add(HtmlTree.CODE(excName));
921        List<? extends DocTree> description = ch.getDescription(throwsTag);
922        Content desc = htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(element, description,
923            context.within(throwsTag));
924        if (desc != null && !desc.isEmpty()) {
925            body.add(" - ");
926            body.add(desc);
927        }
928        return HtmlTree.DD(body);
929    }
930
931    @Override
932    public Content throwsTagOutput(TypeMirror throwsType,
933            Optional<Content> content) {
934        var linkInfo = new HtmlLinkInfo(configuration, HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.PLAIN,
935            throwsType);
936        var link = htmlWriter.getLink(linkInfo);
937        var concat = new ContentBuilder(HtmlTree.CODE(link));
938        if (content.isPresent()) {
939            concat.add(" - ");
940            concat.add(content.get());
941        }
942        return HtmlTree.DD(concat);
943    }

945    @Override
946    public Content valueTagOutput(VariableElement field, String constantVal,
947            boolean includeLink) {
948        return includeLink
949            ? htmlWriter.getDocLink(
950                HtmlLinkInfo.Kind.LINK_TYPE_PARAMS_AND_BOUNDS, field,
951                constantVal)
952            : Text.of(constantVal);
953    }

955    @Override
956    protected Content invalidTagOutput(String summary,
957            Optional<String> detail) {
958        return htmlWriter.invalidTagOutput(summary,
959            detail.isEmpty() || detail.get().isEmpty()
960                ? Optional.empty()
961                : Optional.of(Text.of(Text.normalizeNewlines(detail.get()))));
962    }

966            List<? extends DocTree> tags) {
967        return commentTagsToOutput(null, holder, tags, false);
968    }

971    public Content commentTagsToOutput(Element element,
972            List<? extends DocTree> tags) {
973        return commentTagsToOutput(element, null, tags, false);
974    }

976    @Override
977    public Content commentTagsToOutput(Element holder,
978            DocTree holderTag,
979            List<? extends DocTree> tags,
980            boolean isFirstSentence) {
981        return htmlWriter.commentTagsToContent(holder,
982            tags, holderTag == null ? context : context.within(holderTag));
983    }

985    @Override
986    public BaseConfiguration configuration() {
987        return configuration;
988    }

990    @Override
991    protected TypeElement getCurrentPageElement() {
992        return htmlWriter.getCurrentPageElement();
993    }
994
995    public HtmlDocletWriter getHtmlWriter() {
996        return htmlWriter;
997    }
998
999    private Content createAnchorAndSearchIndex(Element element, String tagText,
1000            String desc, DocTree tree) {
1001        return createAnchorAndSearchIndex(element, tagText, Text.of(tagText),
1002            desc, tree);
1003    }
1004
1005    @SuppressWarnings("preview")
1006    private Content createAnchorAndSearchIndex(Element element, String tagText,
1007            Content tagContent, String desc, DocTree tree) {
1008        Content result = null;
1009        if (context.isFirstSentence && context.inSummary
1010            || context.inTags.contains(DocTree.Kind.INDEX)) {
1011            result = tagContent;
1012        } else {
1013            HtmlId id = HtmlIds.forText(tagText, htmlWriter.indexAnchorTable);
1014            result = HtmlTree.SPAN(id, HtmlStyle.searchTagResult, tagContent);
1015            if (options.createIndex() && !tagText.isEmpty()) {
1016                String holder = getHolderName(element);
1017                IndexItem item
1018                    = IndexItem.of(element, tree, tagText, holder, desc,
1019                        new DocLink(htmlWriter.path, id.name()));
1020                configuration.mainIndex.add(item);
1021            }
1022        }
1023        return result;
1024    }
1025
1026    String getHolderName(Element element) {
1027        return new SimpleElementVisitor14<String, Void>() {
1028
1029            @Override
1030            public String visitModule(ModuleElement e, Void p) {
1031                return resources.getText("doclet.module")
1032                    + " " + utils.getFullyQualifiedName(e);
1033            }
1034
1035            @Override
1036            public String visitPackage(PackageElement e, Void p) {
1037                return resources.getText("doclet.package")
1038                    + " " + utils.getFullyQualifiedName(e);
1039            }
1040
1041            @Override
1042            public String visitType(TypeElement e, Void p) {
1043                return utils.getTypeElementKindName(e, true)
1044                    + " " + utils.getFullyQualifiedName(e);
1045            }
1046
1047            @Override
1048            public String visitExecutable(ExecutableElement e, Void p) {
1049                return utils
1050                    .getFullyQualifiedName(utils.getEnclosingTypeElement(e))
1051                    + "." + utils.getSimpleName(e)
1052                    + utils.flatSignature(e,
1053                        htmlWriter.getCurrentPageElement());
1054            }
1055
1056            @Override
1057            public String visitVariable(VariableElement e, Void p) {
1058                return utils
1059                    .getFullyQualifiedName(utils.getEnclosingTypeElement(e))
1060                    + "." + utils.getSimpleName(e);
1061            }
1062
1063            @Override
1064            public String visitUnknown(Element e, Void p) {
1065                if (e instanceof DocletElement de) {
1066                    return switch (de.getSubKind()) {
1067                    case OVERVIEW -> resources.getText("doclet.Overview");
1068                    case DOCFILE -> getHolderName(de);
1069                    };
1070                } else {
1071                    return super.visitUnknown(e, p);
1072                }
1073            }
1074
1075            @Override
1076            protected String defaultAction(Element e, Void p) {
1077                return utils.getFullyQualifiedName(e);
1078            }
1079        }.visit(element);
1080    }
1081
1082    private String getHolderName(DocletElement de) {
1083        PackageElement pe = de.getPackageElement();
1084        if (pe.isUnnamed()) {
1085            // if package is unnamed use enclosing module only if it is named
1086            Element ee = pe.getEnclosingElement();
1087            if (ee instanceof ModuleElement
1088                && !((ModuleElement) ee).isUnnamed()) {
1089                return resources.getText("doclet.module") + " "
1090                    + utils.getFullyQualifiedName(ee);
1091            }
1092            return pe.toString(); // "Unnamed package" or similar
1093        }
1094        return resources.getText("doclet.package") + " "
1095            + utils.getFullyQualifiedName(pe);
1096    }
1097}
